characters.definition: The iunctus who becomes friends with Vis in Duat.
One of the upper class of Duat.
Iunctus who is questioned by Caeror.
The man in control of Duat.
Child iunctus who appears to obey Netiqret.
A woman who assists Vis in Duat.
The native name chosen by Vis to help conceal his identity within Duat.
The iunctus who Vis practices on with an Instruction Blade.
The assessor for dancers at the Festival of the Return.

glossary.definition: An ancient device that can transport people from one location to another at great speeds.
The mysterious, ancient enemy who waged a war against humanity many thousands of years ago.
A iunctus under the control of Ka. Able to fly. Its dual stone and obsidian blades enable it to bring people back to life and then interrogate them.
The obsidian blades affixed to the Gleaners' arms. Enable the command of iunctii who are pierced through the heart with them.
Someone who has been brought back from the dead.
The "Chosen of Ka," men and women who live in luxury in exchange for giving up their lives to become iunctii servants at a prime age.
An amulet with a scarab on it, which acts as a powerful Vitaerium.
An assassin who is paid to kill targets "naturally," allowing them to be purchased by the wealthy when they become iunctii.
A collection of iunctii which act as a central guiding mind for controlling Duat.
Black-clothed iunctii that enforce Ka's orders throughout Duat.
A slang term in Duat for iunctii.

locations.definition: A massive, completely enclosed city in the northern deserts.
The poison-filled river that runs through the heart of Duat.
The glowing pyramid at the centre of Duat, which provides light to the city and changes hue in order to indicate the approximate time of day outside.
The acres of structures surrounding the Pyramid of Ka, largely reserved for priests and Ka-shabti.
Everything west of the Infernis in Duat. Where the iunctii are housed.
The collection of ancient tombs in which a small community hides from Ka.
